bibl.title: Papyri of Medical Content.
bibl.note: 1. P. Berol. 21137 verso + 6934 verso. Corpus Hippocr., Epistulae, IV, V, XI. Inv. 21137 belongs to the roll whose verso (Inv. 6934) was published as B.K.T. III, 5-9 (= Pack2 542; Marganne 2). Arsinoite nome (?), late 2nd or early 3rd c. A.D. - 2. P. Monac. Graec. 329 + P. Berol. 21141 joins to a papyrus codex from Munich edited by: Daniela Manetti, Ricerche di Filologia Classica. I (Pisa, 1981) pp. 115-123 et 1 pl. Hermoupolis (?), early 3rd c. A.D.
bibl.seg: 141.4 P. Berol. Inv. 6934 verso + 21137 verso P. Berol. Inv. 21141 + P. Monac. Graec. Inv. 329
Hanson Ann Ellis, Papyri of Medical Content.
Naphtali Lewis (Ed.), Papyrology = YCS 28 (1985) pp. 25-47 et pl. V.

1. P. Berol. 21137 verso + 6934 verso. Corpus Hippocr., Epistulae, IV, V, XI. Inv. 21137 belongs to the roll whose verso (Inv. 6934) was published as B.K.T. III, 5-9 (= Pack2 542; Marganne 2). Arsinoite nome (?), late 2nd or early 3rd c. A.D. - 2. P. Monac. Graec. 329 + P. Berol. 21141 joins to a papyrus codex from Munich edited by: Daniela Manetti, Ricerche di Filologia Classica. I (Pisa, 1981) pp. 115-123 et 1 pl. Hermoupolis (?), early 3rd c. A.D.
